Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as an assault on freedom of speech, which is considered a fundamental human right.
Misinformation is subjective and what is considered misinformation by one person may be seen as information by another.
The legislation would give an unelected body, ACMA, too much power to decide what is true, which is viewed as undemocratic and authoritarian.
More freedom of speech and debate is necessary to arrive at the truth, not less.
Main Themes: Historical examples of free speech leading to truth
Notable Quotes: Freedom is a 'human right', and Freedom of Speech is a human right that has been written into the UDHR.
What is 'information' to one person may be 'misinformation' to another.
This is not democracy... it is totalitarian authoritarianism.
More thought, speech, debate and Freedom of that speech is required for us to arrive at the truth on many issues, not less.
